name, age, height (cm), weight (kg)

What is the name of the last animal sorted by alphabetic order?
Options:
(A) Jody
(B) Louis
(C) Louise
(D) Marian
(E) Vincent
model_answer:
LECTURE: Tables are organized spreads of data that have rows and columns. A table is used to organize and display data that has a clear relationship.
A table has a caption, which tells you the purpose of the table. The caption comes after the table and in italics.
Every table must have a title. The title tells you the name of the table.
A table has one or more rows, which are called entries or lines. Each entry contains data about one object or set of objects.
An entry has one or more cells. Each cell is located at the intersection of a row and a column. Each cell contains either data or a label.
SOLUTION: To put the table in alphabetical order, put the table in order by its first element. If the first elements are the same, look at the second elements, and so on.
If one element is shorter, and there are no more elements to compare, then the first element is smaller. For example, 5 is smaller than 9.
Since Louise is the last animal sorted by alphabetical order, that name is in alphabetical order. The other names are not in alphabetical order.
